page.title: 19LILLESHALL-QUARRIES
page.content: The{quarries and limestone mines}began in the late{1600's to mid 1700's}.The mines were joined by a{canal} commissioned by{Earl Gower(1st Marquis {of Stafford 1786)}and built by{John and{Thomas Gilbert}.It was the first in{Shropshire}and branches of it served the mines,taking limestone from {Lilleshall to Lilleshall Company}.The last underground working closed in 1882.The canal branches were abandoned in 1878-1879.The remains of the quarries,mines and limekilns can be seen to the East of Limekiln Lane behind Barrack Lane.Some canal branches and bridges can still be traced including the{Incline Plain which was built to move boats from one level to another.It is now a grassy slope{near Hugh's Bridge.
